stepper.step_three: I act in case of a hazard or alert

header.footer: The online PIMS is developed by the Directorate General for Civil Security and Crisis Management

home_screen.protection: Facing major risks: protect yourself and your loved ones in just a few minutes

online_procedure.title: Your PIMS online process
online_procedure.content: To be ready to face major risks (flood, storm, industrial accident, etc.), it is important to prepare. This process allows you in less than five minutes to:

items.item_2: associate them with appropriate safety behaviors to be less vulnerable if an event occurs,
items.item_4: get information on the public alert and vigilance procedures,
items.item_5: create your PIMS: a synthetic document in PDF format, with all this information, which you can save directly to your device for easy access when needed.

recipient.title: Who is the online PIMS process for?
recipient.content: This process is for all citizens, as everyone is concerned by major risks and must play a role in their own safety and that of others. It is a clear, simple, and quick process that can be done by anyone.

information.title: What information is required to complete my PIMS online?
information.content: Only a postal address is required. No account creation or personal data will be requested.

steps.title: What are the steps to complete my PIMS online?
steps.content: The online PIMS process is simple: it consists of five steps and takes less than five minutes.

items.step_three: <k1>I act</k1> in case of a hazard or alert

home_screen.mandatory_fields: Fields marked with a red asterisk are mandatory to proceed with the process.

address.title: Know the risks near my home

information_screen.no_risks_around: There are no identified risks around your position.
information_screen.see_more_risks: I check all the natural and technological risks that exist, in addition to those concerning my address.

gathering_place.title: Gathering place
gathering_place.hint: In the event of an evacuation, the gathering place is

iode_pastille.title: You are eligible for the iodine tablet!
iode_pastille.description: Your commune is located within the perimeter of the {{ inb }} Basic Nuclear Facility. Make sure you have collected your iodine tablets from a pharmacy.
iode_pastille.pharmacy_map: Find here the map of pharmacies partnering the iodine tablet distribution campaign.

preventions.item_1: Shelter immediately in a nearby enclosed building
Anticipate by obtaining free iodine tablets from the pharmacy

preventions.item_2: If you cannot, shelter in a nearby enclosed building to limit exposure to danger
Close and reinforce doors, windows, and shutters
preventions.item_3: Breathe through a mask or damp cloth if the air is too full of gas or ash

preventions.item_1: Leave the forest immediately or shelter in a solid building
preventions.item_2: Avoid leaving your car. If caught by flames, stop in a clear area
preventions.item_3: You are safer in a building; evacuate only if ordered by authorities

preventions.item_1: Move away from valley bottoms and watercourses
preventions.item_2: Take refuge as high as possible
preventions.item_3: At home, turn off water, gas, electricity

preventions.item_2: Move away from anything that could collapse

preventions.item_1: Shelter in a building, preferably solid
preventions.item_4: Avoid going out during the cyclone's eye

preventions.item_1: On land: evacuate the coastline immediately on foot

emergency_kit_screen.kit_preparation: I prepare without delay an emergency kit containing enough to live autonomously for 3 days in case of sudden evacuation or sheltering.

kit_listing.title: Here is the list of essential contents for my 72-hour emergency kit:

items.item_3: A first aid kit (alcohol, bandages, gauze, ...)
items.item_5: Non-perishable food that does not require cooking (canned goods, baby food jars)
items.item_6: Warm clothes and a survival blanket
items.item_7: A flashlight (with spare batteries, candles, lighter)
items.item_11: A sufficient amount of drinking water (6 liters per person)
items.item_12: Photocopies of essential documents in a waterproof pouch
items.item_13: Spare keys for the house and car
items.iode_pastille: The iodine tablets retrieved in pharmacy

kit_listing.checkbox: I have acknowledged the essential contents of my emergency kit

kit_storage.accessibility: I store my 72-hour emergency kit in an easily accessible place and share its location with my loved ones
kit_storage.input_placeholder: I enter here the storage location of my emergency kit

emergency.subtitle: To dial in case of emergency
emergency.114: Emergency call number for the <k1>hearing impaired</k1>: <k2>114</k2>

emergency_kit_screen.go_to_next_step: To proceed to the next step, you must have checked that you have acknowledged the contents of the emergency kit, and filled in your kit storage location.

alert_screen.crisis: During the crisis, <k1>I follow the evolution of the situation.</k1>

weather_vigilance.title: Weather vigilance
weather_vigilance.awareness: I monitor the evolution of vigilance:

alert_systems.title: Population alert
alert_systems.activation: In case of life-threatening risk, the authorities can activate:

fr_alert.title: The FR-Alert system
fr_alert.content: The <k1>FR-Alert system</k1> sends a message directly to all mobile phones (without registration or download) with the associated instructions.
fr_alert.simulation: Push on the following button to see and example of an FR-Alert notification:

saip.title: The SAIP sirens
saip.content: The <k1>SAIP sirens</k1> trigger a sound signal of 3 times 1'41.

saip_guidelines.no_phone: <k1>Avoid making phone calls</k1> to keep the networks available for emergency services
saip_guidelines.stay_safe: <k1>Stay sheltered</k1> and only evacuate your home if ordered by the authorities

public_medias.title: Public media
public_medias.content: Public media will be the relay of the authorities in emergency situations to communicate with the population.

notification.title: FR-ALERT: Extreme Alert 11/11/2023 09:19 AM
notification.body_2: Message from the prefecture of Pas de Calais
notification.body_3: Exceptional flood that may exceed historical levels.

body_4.item_2: 2. Seek refuge as high as possible.
body_4.item_3: 3. In case of flooding in your home, turn off water, gas, electricity.
body_4.item_5: 5. Contact 18 in case of extreme necessity (life-threatening emergencies).

notification.body_5: Follow the authorities' instructions and stay in a safe place until the end of the alert is given.

radio_frequencies.title: Follow the official instructions, you will contribute to your safety and support the actions of emergency services!

jnr.title: I participate in awareness actions near my home during the National Resilience Day!
jnr.link: I find the events around my location on <k1>the NRD map</k1>

items.item_1: I train in life-saving techniques with firefighters or an accredited civil protection association
items.item_2: I become a volunteer firefighter and participate in rescue operations
items.item_3: I join my municipality's civil protection reserve to participate in the support and assistance of the population
items.item_4: I register on the public volunteer platform: <k1>{{- urlVolunteering }}</k1>

information.title: I get information from dedicated sites

items.item_1: I get information on effects and threats: <k1>{{- urlGeorisques }}</k1>, <k2>{{- urlGouvRisks }}</k2>
items.item_2: I get information on building preservation measures: <k1>{{- urlBuildingPreservations }}</k1>

information_check.title: I verify my data
information_check.warning: By clicking on the 'Modify' buttons, you will be redirected to the corresponding pages.

items.gathering_place_unknown: You have not entered this information
items.kit_storage: I verify the storage location of my 72-hour emergency kit

name.title: I name my PIMS
name.placeholder: I name my PIMS (home, vacation, grandma's, ...)

locale.title: I choose the language of my generated PIMS

final_screen.success: Congratulations, your PIMS '{{ customName }}' has been successfully generated in PDF version!

actions.introducer: You can now download it and share it with those around you.
actions.copyToClipboard: The link has been successfully copied to the clipboard.

final_screen.goBackHome: Go back to the home screen

edition.title: Site Edition
edition.url: The present site, accessible at the URL {{- domain }} (the <<Site>>), is published by:

publication.title: Publication Director
publication.content: The Publication Director of the Site is {{ director }}.

hosting.title: Hosting
hosting.content: The Site is hosted by Vercel, Inc., located at 340 S Lemon Ave #4133, Walnut, CA 91789, USA, (phone or email contact: +15592887060).

cookies_analytics.title: Audience Measurement Cookies
cookies_analytics.content: Our site uses audience measurement cookies. Some of these cookies are strictly necessary for the functioning and routine administration of the site.

links_and_content.title: Reuse of Content and Links
links_and_content.licence: Unless explicitly stated as third-party intellectual property, the content on this site is offered under the <k1>Etalab Open License 2.0</k1>.
links_and_content.rights: You are free to reproduce, copy, modify, extract, transform, communicate, disseminate, redistribute, publish, transmit, and exploit this content provided that you mention its source, the date of the last update, and do not mislead third parties regarding the information contained within.
links_and_content.diffuse_information: Any public or private website is authorized to establish a link (including deep links) to the information disseminated on this site without prior authorization.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.content: The Site is developed in accordance with the recommendations of the General Accessibility Improvement Reference (RGAA) and W3C standards. We are committed to continuously improving the accessibility of our content to facilitate access to information.

accessibility_page.title: Accessibility Statement
accessibility_page.basep_commitment: The Public Alert, Awareness, and Education Bureau is committed to making its service accessible, in accordance with Article 47 of Law No. 2005-102 of February 11, 2005.
accessibility_page.declaration: This accessibility statement applies to the <k1>Digital Individual Safety Plan</k1> teleprocedure ({{- url }}).

conformity.title: Compliance status
conformity.description: The <k1>Digital Individual Safety Plan</k1> is <k1>non-compliant</k1> with the <k2>RGAA</k2>.

right_of_recourse.title: Right of recourse
right_of_recourse.description: This procedure should be used in the following case: you have reported an accessibility issue to the website administrator that prevents you from accessing content or one of the services on the portal, and you have not received a satisfactory response.

actions.defense: Write a message to the <k1>Defender of Rights</k1>
actions.delegate: Contact <k1>the regional delegate of the Defender of Rights in your area</k1>
actions.send_letter: Send a letter by mail (free, no stamp required):

accessibility_page.generator: This accessibility statement was created on September 20, 2024, using the <k1>Accessibility Statement Generator by BetaGouv</k1>.

introduction.data_analysis: To provide an optimal user experience, the site <k1>{{- domain }}</k1> processes personal information.
introduction.law: In accordance with <k1>Law No. 78-17 of January 6, 1978</k1> concerning data processing, files, and freedoms, as well as the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), we collect and publish personal data. We inform you of the rights you have over your personal data and the measures we take to protect it.

rights.title: Exercising Your Rights
rights.introduction: For any information or to exercise your data protection rights, you can contact the Data Protection Officer at the Ministry of the Interior (with a copy of your ID if exercising your rights):
rights.via_letter: or by mail at the following address:
rights.data_policy: All personal data collected is treated with the strictest confidentiality. In particular, state services are committed to respecting the confidentiality of emails transmitted through electronic messaging. Emails and email addresses are only kept for as long as necessary to process them.
rights.contact_cnil: In the event of a dispute regarding the exercise of your rights, or if you believe your claim concerns a violation of the Data Protection Law, you may contact the National Commission on Informatics and Liberty (CNIL) at the following contacts:

introduction.cookies_creation: When browsing our platform <k1>{{- domain }}</k1>, cookies are placed on your computer, mobile, or tablet.
introduction.use_case: We use different types of cookies to secure our site, measure its traffic, and also to offer videos, sharing buttons, content from social platforms, animated and interactive content, and, more broadly, to improve your browsing experience.

definition.title: Definition of a Cookie
definition.content_1: A cookie is a small text file placed on your hard drive by the server of the visited site or by a third-party server (advertising network or web analytics service). A cookie allows a visitor to be recognized when they return to a website.
definition.content_2: Technically, a cookie recognizes a machine, not an individual user. A cookie can only be used by the server of the domain that placed it. Cookies are managed by your web browser.
definition.content_3: Cookies allow automatic access to personalized pages without needing to log in or identify revisits. They store user data to facilitate navigation and enable certain features.

pims_cookies.title: Cookies Used
pims_cookies.banner: During your first visit to the site <k1>{{- domain }}</k1>, a banner informs you about the presence of these cookies and invites you to make your choice. Cookies are only placed if you accept them. You can adjust cookie settings at any time by accessing the 'Cookie Management' option at the bottom of each page of the site. You can also refuse cookies by configuring your browser settings.

analytics.title: Audience Measurement Cookies
analytics.content_1: To better serve you and improve the user experience on our site, we measure its traffic using a solution that employs cookies. The collected data provides only anonymous statistical data about site visits (number of page views, number of visits, return frequency, etc.).

opposition.title: How to Block Cookies via Your Browser
opposition.deactivation: You can choose to disable all cookies at any time, even those necessary for the website's operation. However, your user experience may be degraded. If you wish to disable only non-essential cookies, use our cookie management tool.
opposition.deactivation_per_browser: Here are the procedures to block cookie creation from your browser settings:

object.title: Purpose of the Processing
object.content_1: By personal data, we mean any information relating to an identified or identifiable individual on the site <k1>{{- domain }}</k1>.
object.content_2: The legal basis for the processing, as provided in Article 6 of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), is as follows: the processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the data controller.

rights.title: Rights of Data Subjects
rights.law: In accordance with all applicable regulations, you have rights concerning your data. These rights may vary depending on the type of data involved.

right_access.title: Right of Access
right_access.description: The right of access is exercised under the conditions outlined in Article 15 of the GDPR. You can make a request to know the data we hold about you, and obtain a copy.

right_information.title: Right to Information
right_information.description: You have the right to be informed at any time, clearly, transparently, and comprehensibly, about how your data is processed.

right_rectification.title: Right to Rectification
right_rectification.description: Any incomplete or incorrect data concerning you can be corrected at your request. You can also supplement your data at any time by providing additional information.

right_deletion.title: Right to Erasure
right_deletion.description: The right to erasure does not apply under Article 17 3. b) of the GDPR.

right_limit_treatment.title: Right to Restrict Processing
right_limit_treatment.description: The right to restrict processing is exercised under the conditions outlined in Article 18 of the GDPR.

right_opposition.title: Right to Object
right_opposition.description: If you exercise this right, the Ministry of the Interior and Overseas may ask you for reasons related to your particular situation and may oppose your request with compelling and legitimate reasons that override your claim, in accordance with Article 21-1 of the GDPR.
